text:
13˚And we also thank God constantly for this,
     that when you received the word of God,
         which you heard from us,
               you accepted it
                   not as the word of men
                   but as what it really is,
                          the word of God,
         which is at work in you believers.
14˚For you,
       brothers,
       became imitators of the churches of God
                           in Christ Jesus
                           that are in Judea.
   For you
       suffered the same things
         from your own countrymen
         as they did from the Jews,
         15˚who killed both the Lord Jesus
                            and the prophets,
            and drove us out,
            and displease God
            and oppose all mankind
             16˚by hindering us from speaking to the Gentiles
                                that they might be saved—
            so as always to fill up the measure of their sins.
            But wrath has come upon them at last!

God: has a word that can be received and accepted
was displeased by the persecution of the Jews
Author: constantly thanked God that the Thessalonians accepted the word of God
spoke the word of God to the Thessalonians
were driven out of Judea by the Jews persecuting Christ
were hindered by the Jews of Judea from speaking the gospel to the gentiles
Thessalonians: accepted the word of God as the word of God, not the word of man
were being worked in by the word of God
became imitators of the persecuted church in Judea

definitions.at work: ἐνεργεῖται energeitai G1754; effectually works; to be operative, be at work, put forth power
definitions.displease: μὴ ἀρεσκόντων; mē areskōnton; G3361 G700; not please
definitions.fill up: ἀναπληρῶσαι; anaplērōsai; G378; to fill a vessel up to the brim; up to the appointed measure or standard

keywords.really: as used in verse 13, referring to the true essence of the word the missionaries spoke to the Thessalonians, that it is not some message of mere men, but is in truth, in reality the word of God. Let us then listen and behold.

points: The Thessalonians accepted the word the missionaries spoke as the word of God
The word of God effectually works in believers
The Thessalonians endured persecution from their own countrymen
To oppose the preaching of the gospel is to oppose mankind
Wrath comes upon those who oppose the preaching of Jesus
titles: The true and effectual word of God
The gospel, the hope of mankind
The word at work in you
The word that is worth it

unwisdom.saying: The one who knows much is the one who seeks often. In such wandering are many wonders found.
unwisdom.comment: What's under this rock? If I try and try, I think I can do it! We can spend our entire lives in the pursuit of truth and meaning, but on our own we will die before we arrive. Or more likely, we will wander off into some cave of self-gratifying falseness. Or we can listen to the word of God, truth come to us.

unwisdom.saying: The Bible is very helpful, but often you need a little more
unwisdom.comment: This Book of the Law shall not depart from your mouth. So keep and follow the words of this covenant, that you may prosper in all you do. But his delight is in the law of the LORD, and on His law he meditates day and night. I have stored up your word in my heart, that I might not sin against you. And they devoted themselves to the apostles' teaching and the fellowship, to the breaking of bread and the prayers.

conversation.question: What is the proof in your life that the word of God is at work in you? How do you know it is the word of God and something else working in you?
Do you want the word of God to work in you? What’s the risk if it doesn’t? What will determine if the word of God works in you over the next month?
